As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions but I can objectively say that government policies and regulations play a critical role in shaping the transition towards sustainable energy sources. While some governments have taken significant steps to incentivize the adoption of renewable energy technologies, there is still a need for more comprehensive and ambitious policy frameworks that can accelerate this transition.

One crucial area where governments can take action is in providing financial support to individuals and businesses who are making the switch to sustainable energy sources. This can take the form of tax breaks, subsidies, grants, and other incentives that help to offset the initial costs of adopting new technologies.

Another important area where governments can take action is in imposing stricter regulations on industries that refuse to change their ways. This can include tightening emissions standards, imposing carbon taxes, and implementing other regulatory measures that make it more costly for companies to rely on fossil fuels.

By working together to create a comprehensive policy framework that incentivizes the adoption of sustainable energy technologies and impose stricter regulations on industries that refuse to change their ways, governments can help to accelerate the transition towards a more sustainable and prosperous future.
